SE450: Using Command Line Tools: Download Ant and Junit Together [14/16]

You can also run ant/junit by doing the following:

  • make a directory called "util" in the same directory with build.xml
  • Copy http://condor.depaul.edu/~jriely/450-code/util/antjunit.jar and http://condor.depaul.edu/~jriely/450-code/util/ant.bat into the util directory.
  • Edit the local copy of ant.bat to suit your system. Say I am using JDK1.6.0 and downloaded ant.bat and antjunit.jar to E:\jriely\450; then I set the variables as follows. 
    set JAVA_HOME=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01
set ANTJUNIT=E:\jriely\450\antjunit.jar
  • Open a cmd window and make sure you are in the directory where you unzipped the homework: 
    E:\jriely\450\hw-01> dir /b
build.properties
build.xml
extra
source
  • Run ant using the absolute path of ant.bat: 
    E:\jriely\450\hw-01> E:\jriely\450\ant.bat
  • Use the up arrow key to run it again.

You can put this on a USB key and run ant anywhere the JDK is installed, simply by changing these two variables to match the system you are plugged into.
